com.quest.glue.api.services
Interface WMISecuritySettings

public interface WMISecuritySettings

Security settings for WMI connections. Most applications will not need to specify settings, in which case a null value can be provided to the WMIConnectionService3's establish methods. However, some WMI objects require specific authentication settings in order to be accessed.

Those settings depend on what data the agent is attempting to access, therefore it is the agent's responsibility to provide appropriate connection security settings when establishing connections.

Note that these settings are immutable. They can be shared between multiple connections, but once created the security settings for a connection cannot be changed at all. This interface provides accessors to the current security values in case the agent would like to inspect them.

New security settings are created by calling WMIConnectionService3.createSecuritySettings(com.quest.glue.api.services.WMIAuthenticationLevel, com.quest.glue.api.services.WMIImpersonationLevel, java.util.Collection).

Note: These security settings are not related to Foglight's credential management store. Rather, they are part of Microsoft's WMI interface. A good overview of WMI security is available on Microsoft TechNet

Since:
5.5.5.4

Method Summary
 WMIAuthenticationLevel getAuthenticationLevel()
          Return the current authentication level.
 WMIImpersonationLevel getImpersonationLevel()
          Return the current impersonation level.
 java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> getPrivileges()
          Return the current set of privileges that will be requested for connections made with these settings.
 

Method Detail

getAuthenticationLevel

WMIAuthenticationLevel getAuthenticationLevel()
Return the current authentication level. If this value is null then the default Windows authentication level is used. This is the recommended setting that allows WMI to negotiate to the level required by the server returning data.

Returns:
The authentication level configured for these settings

getImpersonationLevel

WMIImpersonationLevel getImpersonationLevel()
Return the current impersonation level. If this value is null then a default impersonation level will be used. The default level is specified in the Windows registry on the machine where FglAM is running under the key HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\WBEM\Scripting\Default Impersonation Level. It is usually set to 3, meaning the Impersonate level.

Returns:
The impersonation level configured for these settings

getPrivileges

java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> getPrivileges()
Return the current set of privileges that will be requested for connections made with these settings. This parameter is optional can can be null, in which case the WMI connection services will default to the user's set of permissions.

The MSDN contains a list of known permission strings.

Returns:
A read-ony collection of the permissions associated with this connection
